ranked_diseases.explanation: Fragile X Syndrome is a genetic condition that causes intellectual disability, autistic behavior, and macrocephaly (which can sometimes present as macrodontia). It is one of the most common causes of inherited intellectual disability.
KBG Syndrome is characterized by intellectual disability, macrodontia, and skeletal anomalies including hand abnormalities. Autistic behavior can also be present.
Sotos Syndrome is associated with intellectual disability, autistic behavior, and macrodontia. While hand abnormalities are less common, they can occur.
Coffin-Siris Syndrome includes intellectual disability, autistic behavior, and hand abnormalities. Macrodontia is less common but has been reported in some cases.
Pitt-Hopkins Syndrome presents with intellectual disability and autistic behavior. While macrodontia and hand abnormalities are not hallmark features, they can occasionally be present.
